unnormalised: Okay, here's a Quora post on rental agreements in the Real Estate & Property category, meeting your specifications:
normalised: Here's the normalized Quora post, following all your specified rules:
**Question:** Rental Agreements in India - What are some things I should absolutely watch out for?

unnormalised: **Question:** Rental Agreements in India - What are some things I should absolutely watch out for?
normalised: Hey everyone! Renting out my little one B H K in Bandra, Mumbai, and wanted to get your collective wisdom on rental agreements here in India. It's my first time being a landlord, and I want to make sure I'm not getting taken for a ride!

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Renting out my little 1BHK in Bandra, Mumbai, and wanted to get your collective wisdom on rental agreements here in India. It's my first time being a landlord, and I want to make sure I'm not getting taken for a ride!
normalised: Besides the obvious stuff like rent amount (rupees twenty five thousand per month in this case!), security deposit (thinking two months, is that standard?), and lock-in period (maybe eleven months?), what else should I be really paying attention to in the agreement?

unnormalised: Besides the obvious stuff like rent amount (Rs. 25,000 pm in this case!), security deposit (thinking 2 months, is that standard?), and lock-in period (maybe 11 months?), what else should I be REALLY paying attention to in the agreement?
normalised: I've heard horror stories from my colleague, Priya, about tenants who completely trashed her apartment and then refused to leave! How can I prevent something like that happening? Is police verification really necessary? I mean, I trust my gut feeling about prospective tenants, but maybe I'm being naive.

unnormalised: I’ve heard horror stories from my colleague, Priya, about tenants who completely trashed her apartment and then refused to leave! How can I prevent something like that happening? Is police verification really necessary? I mean, I trust my gut feeling about prospective tenants, but maybe I’m being naive.
normalised: Also, what about clauses on maintenance? Who pays for what? I'm happy to handle major repairs like plumbing or electrical issues (especially after Diwali lights caused a short circuit last year!), but should the tenant be responsible for minor things?

unnormalised: Also, what about clauses on maintenance? Who pays for what? I’m happy to handle major repairs like plumbing or electrical issues (especially after Diwali lights caused a short circuit last year!), but should the tenant be responsible for minor things?
normalised: And what about subletting? Definitely want to prohibit that, right?

unnormalised: And what about subletting? Definitely want to prohibit that, right?
normalised: Any tips on making sure the agreement is legally sound and enforceable in case things go south? I wouldn't want to end up in a legal battle that lasts longer than it takes to cook a perfect plate of biryani! Any advice from experienced landlords (especially in Mumbai) would be much appreciated. Thanks in advance! Maybe I should consult with a lawyer?

unnormalised: Any tips on making sure the agreement is legally sound and enforceable in case things go south? I wouldn't want to end up in a legal battle that lasts longer than it takes to cook a perfect plate of biryani! Any advice from experienced landlords (especially in Mumbai) would be much appreciated. Thanks in advance! Maybe I should consult with a lawyer?
